'Dispersion' refers to the distribution of a particular chemical constituent or
element in a particular rock or soil, where the concentration of the element
gradually reaches the average value (or background) from high concentrations
with respect to space. Dispersion can be considered as primary or secondary,
based on formational environment.

It occurs when a soil is . When a sodic soil is wetted, the clay particles are
forced apart. This is generally a major cause of erosion.
